name: Zotero
description: Open-source citation management software.

name: mMass
description: Open-source software for mass spectrometers.

name: TiddlyWiki
description: Easily create your own wikis to organize information.

name: Grafana
description: Create a dashboard (online if you wish) that visualizes you experimental data.

name: Evergreen ILS
description: Software for managing a library of books (and the loaning process).

name: OpenSCAD
description: 3D modeling software.

name: ISLE
description: Open-source laboratory equipment inventory management system developed by NASA.

name: SageMath
description: Open-source cloud-based computation (similar to MATLAB and Mathematica).

name: LibreOffice
description: Free and open source productivity software (write documents, spreadsheets, presentations, and more).

name: GNU Octave
description: Free software numerical computation program, similar to MATLAB.

name: GanttProject
description: Productivity tool for scheduling tasks and making Gantt charts.

name: Open Science Framework
description: Open-source collaborative project manager for scientific research.

name: Dia
description: Open-source software for making diagrams.

name: Gephi
description: Open graph visualization platform.

name: QGIS
description: Open GIS software.

name: Calibre
description: eBook management software.

name: Stellarium
description: Open-source planetarium software.

name: Mineways
description: a tool for turning Minecraft model files into 3D-printable .stl files

name: Light and Matter
description: Benjamin Crowell's free-to-download, cheap-to-buy open source physics textbooks.

name: OpenStax
description: Repository of open-licensed and collaboratively-edited textbooks on many basic subjects. You can download them as ebooks or order print copies.

name: PhET Simulations
description: CU Boulder interactive physics and chemistry simulations.

name: United Diversity Co-op Library
description: A vast library of interesting textbooks and other resources in PDF form on such topics as permaculture, agriculture, economics, crafts and activism.

name: Microbe Wiki
description: A large student-edited multi-institutional wiki for microbiology.

name: OpenCulture Textbooks
description: The textbook section of a website dedicated to the open sharing of information.

name: Free Tech Books
description: Free ebooks (mostly computer science and engineering).

name: OpenWetWare
description: A site that maintains a list of bio lab protocols as well as an electronic lab notebook for team use.

name: The ODIN
description: A distributor of affordable DIY biology equipment.

name: Bento Box
description: A low-cost PCR workstation from Bento Lab.

name: OpenTrons
description: An open-source liquid-handling robot.

name: OpenPCR
description: An open-source PCR thermocycler.

name: SGD
description: Stanford University's Saccharomyces Genome Database.

name: BLAST
description: Search tool for local alignment.

name: IORodeo
description: Sells a cheap open-source potentiostat, a colorimeter, and some other equipment.

name: BioSurplus
description: A supplier of used bio lab equipment.

name: Raspberry Shake
description: A seismograph compatible with the Raspberry Pi.

name: Smoky Mountain Scientific
description: Modular, Low cost, open-source instrumentation for environmental monitoring.

name: Thingiverse
description: A search engine for 3D-printable models.

name: Ember
description: A comprehensively open-source DLP SLA 3D Printer project, powered by Autodesk.

name: 3D Printable Science Equipment
description: A list of different 3d-printable science objects with models.

name: Precious Plastic
description: Make your own 3D printer filament.

name: C.H.I.P
description: A $9 Linux computer.

name: Raspberry Pi Zero
description: The cheapest, smallest Raspberry Pi ($5).

name: Particle Electron
description: Raspberry Pi-like microcontroller for connecting the devices you make to the cellular network.

name: SparkFun
description: A company selling all sorts of electronics for DIY projects, including sensors.

name: Red Pitaya
description: Open-source tool with multiple signal processing functions, such as an oscilloscope, spectrum analyzer, signal generator, and more.

name: Podo
description: A stickable, hi-resolution Bluetooth camera.

name: IDA Systems
description: An Indian manufacturer of open hardware devices.

name: Global Village Construction Set
description: Open-source farm equipment and other civilization-building tools.

name: Farming Concrete Data Collection Toolkit
description: "Methods for measuring the outcomes and impacts of community gardens and urban farms."

name: Build My Lab Contest
description: A competition to create instructables for DIY lab equipment.

name: Generic Lab Equipment
description: Wiki with instructions on building DIY lab equipment.

name: Citizen Science: Theory and Practice
description: An open-access, peer-reviewed journal dedicated to discussion about methods in citizen science.

name: Scholar Subreddit
description: A great place to request help getting access to scientific papers that are beyond paywalls.

name: LibGen
description: An online tool for gaining access to scientific articles that are normally beyond paywalls.

name: SciHub
description: Another site for gaining access to science papers that are normally behind paywalls.

name: Public Library of Science (PLOS)
description: Nonprofit organization that publishes open-access journals and also advocates for openness and tranparency in science.

name: arXiv
description: A Cornell-supported site for sharing and discussing early drafts of scientific papers (mostly physics and math).

name: Directory of Open Access Journals
description: Over 9000 journals listed.

name: Investigative Dashboard
description: A tool for researchers, especially journalists, to share documents and findings.

name: Buckets of Resistance: Standards and the Effectiveness of Citizen Science
The Potentials and Limitations of Civil Society Research: Getting Undone Science Done
Institutions for Civic Technoscience: How Critical Making is Transforming Environmental Research
Return on Investment for Open Source Hardware Development
description: by Joshua Pearce, director of MOST (see "other resources" section).

name: Citizen Science as an Ecological Research Tool: Challenges and Benefits
Academic Research in the 21st Century: Maintaining Scientific Integrity in a Climate of Perverse Incentives and Hypercompetition
Genspace
description: One of the oldest and most successful DIY Bio labs, located in Brooklyn, NYC.

name: BioCurious
description: The first biohacking space in the world, located in Sunnyvale, CA

name: HiveBio
description: Seattle community bio lab.

name: SynthTechBio Network
description: Latin American biohackers' network.

name: Four Thieves Vinegar Collective
description: A group working on DIY pharma-hacking projects, such as a $30 alternative to $600 epi-pens.

name: The Community Science Initiative
description: A nonprofit water testing and environmental data organization in Ithaca, NY.

name: Sanctuary for Weedy Species
description: A Brooklyn-based urban ecology project.

name: Coweeta Listening Project
description: Southern Appalachian project combining ecological research with civic action.

name: The Radix Center
description: Community-based urban sustainability / agriculture education center in Albany, NY.

name: The Bucket Brigade
description: A Norco, LA - based citizen science group fighting for environmental justice.

name: Safecast
description: An online citizen science project collecting and visualizing radioactivity data across the globe.

name: Rainforest Connection
description: Project sing old smartphones as sensors to combat illegal logging.

name: The Citizen Science Lab
description: A community science lab based in Pittsburgh, PA.

name: BioBus
description: A mobile science education lab.

name: Hillsboro Library of Things
description: A library for physical objects based in Hillsboro, OR.  Includes some science and tech supplies.

name: Fab Foundation
description: an organization that facilitaties a network of digital fabrication "Fab Labs"

name: Farm Hack
description: A project for producing open farm tools.

name: Coalesce: Center for Biological Arts
description: A bioart studio-lab at SUNY Buffalo

name: Experiment.com
description: A science crowdfunding platform.

name: The Awesome Foundation
description: A nonprofit that funds awesome projects with microgrants $1000 at a time.

name: Endeavorist
description: A "curiosity network" for science and technology that combines a social network with crowdfunding.

name: Herb Society of America
description: Offers some grants that are compatible with small, non-institutional research projects.

name: Seeding Labs
description: Equipment and funding for labs in developing countries.

name: EPA Environmental Education Grants
description: Grants available for small community organizations.

name: CollabFinder
description: A place to find collaborators for your project.

name: OpenLab-Blueprint
description: Informational resources for upstart DIY science labs, put together by members of Genspace.

name: Public Lab
description: A DIY environmental science network.

name: Innovative Citizen
description: An annual citizen science festival in the Ruhr area, Germany, with an emphasis on organic fabrication, bio-hacking, mobile agriculture, and sustainability in urban ecosystems.

name: iGEM
description: Student synthetic biology competition with connections to many DIY bio labs.

name: Biodesign Challenge
description: Student design competition that concentrates on envisioning the future application of biotechnology.

name: Biofabricate
description: A design-focused annual conference that focuses on biotechnology-affiliated design, materials, and techniques.

name: MOST
description: The Pearce Research Group at Michigan Tech in Open Sustainability Technology.

name: OSGeo
description: The Open Source Geospatial Foundation, which offers a lot of open tools for working with GIS data.

name: Open source engineering software
description: A large list maintained on Appropedia.

name: Federal Crowdsourcing and Citizen Science Toolkit
description: Maintained by the US government.

name: The Open Source Hardware Association
description: A resource for all things open hardware, including designs and legal considerations.

name: Science for the People
description: A late 1960s/early 1970s radical science movement whose literature has been organized on a website by UMass Amherst.

name: SciStarter
description: A search engine for finding citizen science projects to participate in.

name: Biocanvas
description: A collection of biological images as art.
